transcripts.text: People thought that I'm crazy, I support Trump.  I'm not crazy.  Trump is a moral disgrace.  I mean, Trump is a... No, it's even...
But you said that the election of Trump was the only thing that could open up the actual ideological crisis.

And it did, because of democratic socialism.  Without Trump, this wouldn't have happened, I claim.  The reaction to Trump showed the only... political battle.  the way I see it.  Now, in the United States, it's the one going on within the Democratic Party.  Yes, we agree. No, he'll be fine.  He'll be fine.  You think so?  No, I'm just saying it because I'm willing it into existence.

No, no, no.  What I want to say is this.  What Trump did is he disturbed this hegemonic peace.  Till Trump, Republican, Democratic Party, there were tensions and so on.  Of course, Democrats were not the same as Dick Cheney and so on.  But basically there was some understanding, you know.  They shared the same field, and that's always how politics works.  It's not only just explicit rules.  It's these customs, unspoken rules, how you do things.  And Trump disturbed this piece.  You have now here some kind of a... ideological civil war.  And why should the left use this opportunity?  Now, I don't know if you read my last piece, published just digitally on this, where I go, and some people again accuse me, you defend Trump.  No, I'm not.  No, sorry, just very briefly.  You know, Even this now impeachment process against Trump, I'm skeptical about it.  Not only, you know, Trump's talked a lot, but he didn't attack North Korea, he didn't attack Iran or Syria.  He's much more cautious here.  This is why many right-wing hardliners are beginning to doubt him.  But I want to tell you another thing here.  For me, this is a clear example of how ideology works.  It's easy to attack Trump Because he's obviously, personally, if not corrupted, then immoral, opportunistic, whatever guy.  But it would be much more interesting, and the lesson of the guys whom I admire, the triad, Assange, Snowden, Chelsea Manning, is... to focus on, let's call it naively, evil, violation of human rights, blah, blah, which are part of the anonymous functioning of the state apparatus.  You don't need an evil guy like Trump to see what NSA is doing in combination with Facebook, with Google, and so on, and so on.  That's why now in a text that appeared only digitally, I said I contrasted Trump with his great enemy, who probably personally is... More or less, although I doubt, honest, James Comey in higher loyalty.  I'm much more afraid of people who do the same stuff, the same, violating of human rights, blah, blah, just on behalf of have some higher loyalty.
